meanings.sent1: Being fallible means that we are not perfect and can make errors.
meanings.sent2: It is important to remember that humans are fallible and can make mistakes.
meanings.sent3: Even the most fallible individuals can learn from their errors and improve.
meanings.sent4: Her memory was as fallible as a leaky bucket, often forgetting important details.
meanings.sent5: The fallible nature of our judgment can lead to unexpected outcomes.

meanings.definition: Likely to fail or be inaccurate.
meanings.sent1: The fallible machine produced inconsistent results due to its design flaws.
meanings.sent2: Weather forecasts are fallible as they are based on predictions.
meanings.sent3: The fallible map led them in circles, causing frustration among the travelers.
meanings.sent4: His fallible memory was like a broken compass, always pointing in the wrong direction.
meanings.sent5: The fallible nature of technology can sometimes lead to unexpected errors.
